verb.description: Rub (someone or something) hard so as to clean them, typically with a brush and water.
examples: he had to scrub the floor
she was scrubbing herself down at the sink
she scrubbed furiously at the plates

noun.description: An act of scrubbing something or someone.
examples: give the floor a good scrub

noun.description: A semiabrasive cosmetic lotion applied to the face or body in order to cleanse the skin.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense stunted tree): variant of shrub.
